meanings.definition: To form or become a rainbow or similar spectrum of colors.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the sun shining on the water created an irising effect.
meanings.sent2: The soap bubbles were irising in the sunlight, displaying a range of colors.
meanings.sent3: The artist's paint palette seemed to be irising with all the vibrant hues blending together.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter irised through the room, spreading joy to everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The garden was irising with flowers of every shade, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: To open or expand in a circular shape, like the iris of an eye.
meanings.sent1: The camera lens was irising open to capture the perfect shot.
meanings.sent2: As the morning light streamed in, the curtains irised slowly to reveal the new day.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella irised open just in time to shield her from the sudden downpour.
meanings.sent4: The hot air balloon irised up into the sky, carrying its passengers on a peaceful journey.
meanings.sent5: The flower petals irised outwards, blooming into a full and colorful display.
